[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Educational and Learning Management System (ELMS) enables users to manage courses, track progress, conduct assessments, and access educational resources.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ELMS supports course creation, scheduling, grading, assessments, student tracking, virtual learning tools, and personalized recommendations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ELMS integrates with student databases, assessment tools, video conferencing, and external learning platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ELMS provides a web and mobile UI for students, teachers, parents, and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ELMS supports desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ELMS uses REST APIs, authentication protocols, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ELMS provides notifications, messaging, forums, and video conferencing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ELMS optimizes storage for student records, course materials, and performance data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ELMS supports course management, student tracking, assessments, and reporting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ELMS customizes learning paths and accessibility features.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ELMS connects with financial literacy platforms, virtual labs, and academic resources.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ELMS facilitates course management, assessments, student engagement, collaboration, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ELMS serves students, teachers, parents, administrators, and librarians.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ELMS requires internet access for real-time updates and communication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ELMS relies on secure cloud storage, third-party learning platforms, and assessment tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow teachers to create, manage, and share course materials.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide students access to courses, assignments, grades, and discussions.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support integration with external educational tools, assessments, and financial literacy resources.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow students to track progress, grades, and coursework (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide personalized learning recommendations based on student performance (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow teachers to create adaptive quizzes that adjust to student ability levels.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall provide real-time student performance tracking and analytics for administrators.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for course navigation, collaboration, and reporting.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process updates, assessments, and student interactions without significant delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store student records, courses, grades, quizzes, and reports.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support secure encryption for student data and transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with educational data privacy and accessibility standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure secure authentication and encrypted data storage.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate course management, student progress tracking, assessments, and compliance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Educational regulations, assessment standards, and data privacy laws.
